laboratory_examinations.findings: White-cell count of 13,600 cells per cubic millimeter (96% neutrophils, 3% lymphocytes, and 1% monocytes); other routine hematologic tests were normal.
Opening pressure 23 cm of water; increased white cell count: Tube 1 - 131, Tube 4 - 80; differential count: Neutrophils 68%, Lymphocytes 11%, Monocytes 6%; Glucose 35 mg/dL; Protein 42 mg/dL.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: CSF findings showed neutrophilic pleocytosis with a white cell count progressing from 7 to 131 (Tube 1) over 6 months prior to the last admission.

laboratory_examinations.findings: New white-matter changes in the internal capsule and multifocal left hemispheric changes; stable encephalomalacia of the left frontal and temporal lobes; diffuse cerebral volume loss.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: MRI showed progression of previous signal abnormalities over the course of treatment.

laboratory_examinations.findings: No oligoclonal bands or malignant cells; all cultures were sterile.
